DataElement.preferredName: Prostate Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Clinical Tumor T Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the primary prostate carcinoma based on information obtained from the date of cancer diagnosis until the start of definitive treatment, or within four months (whichever is shorter), using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Questionnaire Domain T Category Prostate Gland Neoplasm Clinical
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire._One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion)._The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen._A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire.

Property.preferredName: Prostate Gland Neoplasm Clinical T Category
Property.preferredDefinition: The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.:A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.:Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.:One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Concepts.longName: Prostate Gland
Concepts.definition: The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.

Concepts.longName: Neoplasm
Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Concepts.longName: Clinical
Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.

Concepts.longName: T Category
Concepts.definition: One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CDSIC aligned NCI Standard CRFs. ylu

ValueDomain.preferredName: Prostate Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 Clinical T Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of prostate cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system as they pertain to staging of the primary tumor._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion)._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Prostate Cancer cT3a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT3a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer with extraprostatic extension (unilateral or bilateral). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer cT3a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer with extraprostatic extension (unilateral or bilateral). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Prostate Cancer cT4 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT4 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer in which the tumor is fixed or invades adjacent structures other than seminal vesicles such as external sphincter, rectum, bladder, levator muscles, and/or pelvic wall. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer cT4 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer in which the tumor is fixed or invades adjacent structures other than seminal vesicles such as external sphincter, rectum, bladder, levator muscles, and/or pelvic wall. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Prostate Cancer cT3b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT3b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer in which the tumor invades seminal vesicle(s). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer cT3b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer in which the tumor invades seminal vesicle(s). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Prostate Cancer cT3 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT3 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer with extraprostatic tumor that is not fixed or does not invade adjacent structures. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer cT3 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer with extraprostatic tumor that is not fixed or does not invade adjacent structures. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Prostate Cancer cT2c TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT2c TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer in which the tumor involves both sides. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer cT2c TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer in which the tumor involves both sides. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Prostate Cancer cT2b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT2b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer in which the tumor involves more than one-half of one side but not both sides. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer cT2b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer in which the tumor involves more than one-half of one side but not both sides. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Prostate Cancer cT2a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT2a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer in which the tumor involves one-half of one side or less. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer cT2a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer in which the tumor involves one-half of one side or less. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Prostate Cancer cT2 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT2 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer in which the tumor is palpable and confined within the prostate. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer cT2 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer in which the tumor is palpable and confined within the prostate. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Prostate Cancer cT1c TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT1c TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer in which the tumor is identified by needle biopsy found in one or both sides, but not palpable. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer cT1c TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer in which the tumor is identified by needle biopsy found in one or both sides, but not palpable. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Prostate Cancer cT1b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT1b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer in which the tumor is an incidental histologic finding in more than 5% of tissue resected. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer cT1b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer in which the tumor is an incidental histologic finding in more than 5% of tissue resected. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Prostate Cancer cT1a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT1a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer in which the tumor is an incidental histologic finding in 5% or less of tissue resected. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer cT1a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer in which the tumor is an incidental histologic finding in 5% or less of tissue resected. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Prostate Cancer cT1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer with clinically inapparent tumor that is not palpable. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer cT1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer with clinically inapparent tumor that is not palpable. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Prostate Cancer cT0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cT0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer with no evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer cT0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer with no evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Prostate Cancer cTX TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer cTX TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer cTX TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)
